Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in the 1970s, including popular theatrical classics such as The Living Dead at the Manchester Morgue, Zombie, Dawn of the Dead and The Return of the Living Dead.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they going to do next? I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..

However, I was too tired to watch John Carter and fell asleep with approximately 20 minutes left to the movie. Since I missed the ending, now I can go with the extended story line than has kind of been developed in the online community.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty traditional one, with regards to aesthetics, the lack of exposure of the main characters nudity. Including a chest shot would have been great here. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three AVCO Embassy productions with the Phoenix Motion Picture Company based on the TV series. In this edition Joe returns to America from Norway with his friend Rooker (Nicholas Cortland) a beautiful female ninjutsu fighter played by Cary-Hiroyuki
